definitions.definition: Used as a greeting or salutation.
definitions.example: Hello, how are you?

definitions.definition: The earth, together with all of its countries, peoples, and natural features.
definitions.example: The world is a beautiful place.

definitions.definition: A particular group of people or part of society.
definitions.example: the world of sport

definitions.definition: A thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule.
definitions.example: It's a good example of how to proceed.

definitions.definition: A person or thing regarded as a role model.
definitions.example: He sets a good example for his students.

definitions.definition: The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin red or green skin and crisp flesh.
definitions.example: An apple a day keeps the doctor away.

definitions.definition: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has a soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.
definitions.example: He peeled a banana and ate it.

definitions.definition: An electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program.
definitions.example: She spent hours working on her computer.

definitions.definition: A planned series of future events, items, or performances.
definitions.example: a program of cultural events

definitions.definition: A set of instructions enabling a computer to perform a task.
definitions.example: She wrote a computer program.

definitions.definition: Provide (a computer or other machine) with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task.
definitions.example: the computer is programmed to calculate the best route

definitions.definition: A panel of keys that operate a computer or typewriter.
definitions.example: He typed quickly on his keyboard.

definitions.definition: A small rodent with a pointed snout, typically a long, thin tail, and large ears.
definitions.example: A mouse scurried across the floor.

definitions.definition: A small handheld device which is moved across a flat surface to control the movement of a cursor on a computer screen.
definitions.example: Click the left button on your mouse.

definitions.definition: A person who observes or records something.
definitions.example: a school monitor

definitions.definition: A screen used for displaying data from a computer or television.
definitions.example: The monitor showed a clear image.

definitions.definition: The programs and other operating information used by a computer.
definitions.example: We need to update our software.

definitions.definition: Tools, implements, or other items of equipment.
definitions.example: He bought some new hardware for his workshop.

definitions.definition: The mechanical, magnetic, electronic, and electrical components making up a computer system.
definitions.example: The computer's hardware needs an upgrade.

definitions.definition: A global computer network providing a variety of information and communication facilities, consisting of interconnected networks using standardized communication protocols.
definitions.example: The internet has revolutionized communication.

definitions.definition: A set of related web pages served from a single web domain.
definitions.example: She designed a new website.

definitions.definition: A program used to view HTML documents and access files and programs on the Internet.
definitions.example: He opened his web browser to search for information.

definitions.definition: The action or process of extending something or the state of being extended.
definitions.example: an extension of the road network

definitions.definition: A program that extends the functionality of a web browser or other application.
definitions.example: She installed a new browser extension.

definitions.definition: A person or company that creates new products, especially computer software, websites, or apps.
definitions.example: She works as a software developer.

definitions.definition: A system of words, letters, figures, or symbols used to represent others, especially for the purposes of secrecy.
definitions.example: The message was written in code.

definitions.definition: A system of computer programming instructions.
definitions.example: She wrote the code for the new feature.

definitions.definition: An activity or purpose natural to or intended for a person or thing.
definitions.example: the function of the heart

definitions.definition: A block of organized, reusable code that is used to perform a single, related action.
definitions.example: This function calculates the total.

definitions.definition: An element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
definitions.example: The temperature is a variable.

definitions.definition: A data item that may take on more than one value during the runtime of a program.
definitions.example: Declare a variable to store the user's name.
